title: Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Gets Top Court Notice In 2002 Murder Case - NDTV
summary:
Supreme Court Issues Notice to Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim in 2002 Murder Case

Date: Today, Source: New Delhi

The Supreme Court has issued a notice to Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, chief of Dera Sacha Sauda, along with four others in the 2002 murder case of former Dera manager Ranjit Singh, after the CBI challenged the Punjab and Haryana High Court's acquittal.

  • The notice follows the CBI's plea against the acquittal of Ram Rahim and co-accused.
  • The murder occurred on July 10, 2002, related to an anonymous letter alleging sexual exploitation by Ram Rahim.
  • A special CBI court had previously convicted Ram Rahim and four others in 2021, awarding them life imprisonment.
  • In May 2024, the Punjab and Haryana High Court overturned this conviction.
  • Ram Rahim's past convictions include the rape of two women, leading to widespread violence in 2017.
‚ÄúThe CBI court concluded that Ram Rahim orchestrated the murder due to suspicions about Mr. Singh‚Äôs involvement in exposing allegations.‚Äù

This case highlights the ongoing legal battles involving Gurmeet Ram Rahim and the significant societal implications stemming from his actions.
newTitle: Supreme Court Issues Notice to Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim in 2002 Murder Case

summary:

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

A day after gaining nearly 2 percent, the Indian stock market benchmarks‚Äîthe Sensex and the Nifty 50‚Äîsuffered significant losses in morning trade due to profit booking and a strengthening US dollar.

The Sensex opened at 80,072.99 but fell to 79,274.77 before recovering slightly to close at 79,485.28. Meanwhile, the Nifty 50 dropped to 24,000.25 after opening at 24,196.40, reflecting a troubling trend.

  • Profit booking in heavyweights like HDFC Bank and Infosys has led to the current downturn.
  • Investor sentiment remains cautious ahead of Q3 earnings and global policy shifts.
  • The US dollar is at a two-year high, impacting emerging markets negatively.
  • The IT, banking, and financial sectors are experiencing significant selling pressure.
  • Anticipated market volatility due to upcoming US Fed policy decisions and the Union Budget.
‚ÄúWith the dollar index at 109.25 and the US 10-year yield at 4.56 per cent, the macro construct is not favourable for sustained FII buying.‚Äù - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: When, Where And How To Watch The Year's First Shooting Stars In India - Times Now
summary:
Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: When, Where And How To Watch The Year's First Shooting Stars In India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

As 2025 rolls in, skywatchers will witness another dazzling shower, the Quadrantids meteor shower, lighting up the night sky. This annual spectacle of bright, colourful fireballs is known to be one of the most spectacular meteor showers of the year.

  • The Quadrantid meteor shower is active from December 26, 2024, to January 16, 2025.
  • The peak occurs on January 4, 2025, with up to 120 meteors per hour.
  • Best viewing in India is from the night of January 3 to early January 4, with peak intensity around 11:15 PM IST.
  • Ideal viewing locations are remote areas with minimal light pollution.
  • Meteors are best viewed lying on your back, facing northeast.
‚ÄúThe meteors are characterised by bright streaks of light flashing across the sky with a bang.‚Äù

This year‚Äôs Quadrantid meteor shower promises an unforgettable experience for skywatchers, particularly in India where viewers should prepare in remote spots for optimal viewing conditions.
newTitle: Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: Viewing Tips and Details for India

title: Is HMPV another Covid-19-like scare in China? What we know so far - Business Standard
summary:
China Faces Outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) Amidst Respiratory Illness Surge

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Reuters

China is experiencing an outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV), raising concerns as hospitals report being overwhelmed. This outbreak follows a period of reduced exposure to common viruses due to strict COVID-19 measures.

The outbreak primarily impacts vulnerable populations including young children and the elderly. Experts point to the return of normal activities and colder weather as contributing factors.

  • The Chinese government has not issued an official warning despite the surge in cases.
  • Respiratory illnesses similar to flu symptoms are on the rise.
  • Proactive measures are being implemented by health authorities to monitor rising cases of pneumonia.
  • This year's total respiratory infection cases are expected to be lower than in 2024.
‚ÄúChina is likely to face an uptick in respiratory diseases throughout the winter and spring.‚Äù ‚Äì Kan Biao, NCDPA Official

Experts stress the importance of vigilance in monitoring respiratory illnesses as the country navigates the ongoing public health challenges posed by HMPV and other respiratory pathogens.
newTitle: China Faces Outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) Amidst Respiratory Illness Surge

Jill Biden gets $20,000 diamond from PM Modi, priciest gift from any foreign leader in 2023 - The Hindu
summary:
Jill Biden gets $20,000 diamond from PM Modi, priciest gift from any foreign leader in 2023

Published on: January 03, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

During a private dinner at the White House on June 21, 2023, Jill Biden received a 7.5-carat lab-grown diamond from Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking the most expensive gift received by any foreign leader for the year.

  • The diamond is valued at $20,000.
  • Other notable gifts included a $14,063 brooch from the Ukrainian ambassador and various gifts from other international leaders.
  • Federal regulations require gifts exceeding $480 to be reported, with expensive items typically transferred to the National Archives.
  • Jill Biden's diamond is retained for official use in the White House but will be turned over to the archives after leaving office.
  • The report also revealed many lavish gifts received by CIA employees, with most being destroyed.
‚ÄúThe $20,000 diamond was retained for official use in the White House East Wing.‚Äù

This event highlights the implications and regulations surrounding gifts given to U.S. officials by foreign leaders and the cultural exchanges that occur during diplomatic interactions.
newTitle: Jill Biden Receives Expensive Diamond Gift from PM Modi
